section: If CONSULTANT participates directly in any [*****] sponsored photo shoots for advertising or PR, CONSULTANT shall wear his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. The parties further expressly agree that CONSULTANT'S endorsement of the [*****] shall not include the right to place a [*****] logo on his ADAMS GOLF [*****] or the ADAMS GOLF [*****].
explanation: This section contains conflicting instructions regarding what CONSULTANT can wear or display. First, it states that in sponsored photo shoots, CONSULTANT shall wear his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. Then, it restricts CONSULTANT from placing a [*****] logo on his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. These statements create an inconsistency about what the consultant can wear.

section: If CONSULTANT shall find in his sincere best reasonable judgment that the PRODUCT so supplied is not suitable for his use in tournament competition, then he shall promptly notify ADAMS GOLF in writing of such fact and the reasons therefor. Thereafter, ADAMS GOLF shall have a period of thirty (30) days to either, at ADAMS GOLF'S sole discretion, supply CONSULTANT with PRODUCT that is acceptable to him or terminate the agreement.
explanation: The phrase 'sincere best reasonable judgment' is ambiguous. It's unclear how sincerity, 'best,' and 'reasonable' are to be judged in determining suitability. This ambiguity could lead to disputes over whether the consultant's judgment was valid, creating a legal uncertainty.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: This clause states that in the event of CONSULTANT's death or inability to play, ADAMS GOLF can terminate the agreement, and the CONSULTANT or their estate is required to repay ADAMS GOLF for the unperformed period. It seems illogical and unreasonable to require repayment in the case of death or inability to play, as these are circumstances beyond the CONSULTANT's control.
